intro: Uragoga subundulata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed uragoga, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are often slightly undulating in texture. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Its root system is fibrous and has been traditionally used in local herbal medicine for its purported healing properties. Uragoga subundulata thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
